  18. ‌type open_flag = Stdlib.open_flag =
  19.   | Open_rdonly
  20.   | Open_wronly
  21.   | Open_append
  22.   | Open_creat
  23.   | Open_trunc
  24.   | Open_excl
  25.   | Open_binary
  26.   | Open_text
  27.   | Open_nonblock

  29. ‌let stdin = Stdlib.stdin
  30. ‌let open_bin = Stdlib.open_in_bin
  31. ‌let open_text = Stdlib.open_in
  32. ‌let open_gen = Stdlib.open_in_gen

  34. ‌let with_open openfun s f =
  35.   let ic = openfun s in
  36.   Fun.protect ~finally:(fun () -> Stdlib.close_in_noerr ic)
  37.     (fun () -> f ic)

  39. let with_open_bin s f =
  40.   with_open Stdlib.open_in_bin s f

  42. let with_open_text s f =
  43.   with_open Stdlib.open_in s f

  45. let with_open_gen flags perm s f =
  46.   with_open (Stdlib.open_in_gen flags perm) s f

  48. let seek = Stdlib.LargeFile.seek_in
  49. let pos = Stdlib.LargeFile.pos_in
  50. let length = Stdlib.LargeFile.in_channel_length
  51. let close = Stdlib.close_in
  52. let close_noerr = Stdlib.close_in_noerr

  54. let input_char ic =
  55.   match Stdlib.input_char ic with
  56.   | c -> Some c
  57.   | exception End_of_file -> None

  59. ‌let input_byte ic =
  60.   match Stdlib.input_byte ic with
  61.   | n -> Some n
  62.   | exception End_of_file -> None

  64. ‌let input_line ic =
  65.   match Stdlib.input_line ic with
  66.   | s -> Some s
  67.   | exception End_of_file -> None

  69. ‌let input = Stdlib.input

  71. ‌let really_input ic buf pos len =
  72.   match Stdlib.really_input ic buf pos len with
  73.   | () -> Some ()
  74.   | exception End_of_file -> None

  76. ‌let really_input_string ic len =
  77.   match Stdlib.really_input_string ic len with
  78.   | s -> Some s
  79.   | exception End_of_file -> None

  81. (* Read up to [len] bytes into [buf], starting at [ofs]. Return total bytes
  82.    read. *)
  83. ‌let read_upto ic buf ofs len =
  84.   let rec loop ofs len =
  85.     if len = 0 then ofs
  86.     else begin
  87.       let r = Stdlib.input ic buf ofs len in
  88.       if r = 0 then
  89.         ofs
  90.       else
  91.         loop (ofs + r) (len - r)
  92.     end
  93.   in
  94.   loop ofs len - ofs

  96. (* Best effort attempt to return a buffer with >= (ofs + n) bytes of storage,
  97.    and such that it coincides with [buf] at indices < [ofs].

  99.    The returned buffer is equal to [buf] itself if it already has sufficient
  100.    free space.

  102.    The returned buffer may have *fewer* than [ofs + n] bytes of storage if this
  103.    number is > [Sys.max_string_length]. However the returned buffer will
  104.    *always* have > [ofs] bytes of storage. In the limiting case when [ofs = len
  105.    = Sys.max_string_length] (so that it is not possible to resize the buffer at
  106.    all), an exception is raised. *)

  108. ‌let ensure buf ofs n =
  109.   let len = Bytes.length buf in
  110.   if len >= ofs + n then buf
  111.   else begin
  112.     let new_len = ref len in
  113.     while !new_len < ofs + n do
  114.       new_len := 2 * !new_len + 1
  115.     done;
  116.     let new_len = !new_len in
  117.     let new_len =
  118.       if new_len <= Sys.max_string_length then
  119.         new_len
  120.       else if ofs < Sys.max_string_length then
  121.         Sys.max_string_length
  122.       else
  123.         failwith "In_channel.input_all: channel content \
  124.                   is larger than maximum string length"
  125.     in
  126. ‌    let new_buf = Bytes.create new_len in
  127.     Bytes.blit buf 0 new_buf 0 ofs;
  128.     new_buf
  129.   end

  131. ‌let input_all ic =
  132.   let chunk_size = 65536 in (* IO_BUFFER_SIZE *)
  133.   let initial_size =
  134.     try
  135.       Stdlib.in_channel_length ic - Stdlib.pos_in ic
  136.     with Sys_error _ ->
  137.       -1
  138.   in
  139.   let initial_size = if initial_size < 0 then chunk_size else initial_size in
  140. ‌  let initial_size =
  141.     if initial_size <= Sys.max_string_length then
  142.       initial_size
  143.     else
  144.       Sys.max_string_length
  145.   in
  146. ‌  let buf = Bytes.create initial_size in
  147. ‌  let nread = read_upto ic buf 0 initial_size in
  148.   if nread < initial_size then (* EOF reached, buffer partially filled *)
  149.     Bytes.sub_string buf 0 nread
  150.   else begin (* nread = initial_size, maybe EOF reached *)
  151.     match Stdlib.input_char ic with
  152.     | exception End_of_file ->
  153.         (* EOF reached, buffer is completely filled *)
  154.         Bytes.unsafe_to_string buf
  155.     | c ->
  156.         (* EOF not reached *)
  157. ‌        let rec loop buf ofs =
  158.           let buf = ensure buf ofs chunk_size in
  159.           let rem = Bytes.length buf - ofs in
  160.           (* [rem] can be < [chunk_size] if buffer size close to
  161.              [Sys.max_string_length] *)
  162.           let r = read_upto ic buf ofs rem in
  163.           if r < rem then (* EOF reached *)
  164.             Bytes.sub_string buf 0 (ofs + r)
  165.           else (* r = rem *)
  166.             loop buf (ofs + rem)
  167.         in
  168. ‌        let buf = ensure buf nread (chunk_size + 1) in
  169.         Bytes.set buf nread c;
  170.         loop buf (nread + 1)
  171.   end

  173. let [@tail_mod_cons] rec input_lines ic =
  174.   match Stdlib.input_line ic with
  175.   | line -> line :: input_lines ic
  176.   | exception End_of_file -> []

  178. ‌let rec fold_lines f accu ic =
  179.   match Stdlib.input_line ic with
  180.   | line -> fold_lines f (f accu line) ic
  181.   | exception End_of_file -> accu

  183. ‌let set_binary_mode = Stdlib.set_binary_mode_in

  185. external isatty : t -> bool = "caml_sys_isatty"
